paper_title.ja: 学校に出かけていこう－出前授業「省エネ教室」参加記－「（共著）」
CP violation in t→W+b decays in two-Higgs doublet model

paper_title.en: Right-handed b to c and u coupling model and CP violation

description.en: We investigate CP violation in the purely sight-handed b quark to c and u quark coupling model under the constraint on the right-handed W-gauge boson mass M-R > 720 GeV, which has been experimentally obtained recently by the D0 Collaboration at Fermilab. By using the data for the K-L-K-S mass difference, the CP violating parameter epsilon in the neutral kaon system and B-d-(B) over bar(d) mixing, together with the new data Br(B- --> psi pi(-))/Br(B- --> psi K-) = 0.052 +/- 0.024 (approximate to\V-cd/V-cs\(2)), we are able to fix all three independent angles and one phase of the right-handed mixing matrix V-R. Under these constraints, another CP-violating parameter, epsilon'/epsilon, and the electric dipole moment of the neutron are shown to be consistent with the data in our model. The pattern of CP violation in the nonleptonic decay of B-d(B-s) mesons to CP eigenstates is different from that in the standard model.

paper_title.en: CP violation in t→W<sup>+</sup>b decays in two-Higgs doublet model 「(jointly worked)」
Right-handed b to c and u coupling model and CP violation

description.en:
We investigate CP violation in the purely right-handed b quark to c and u quark coupling model under the constraint on the right-handed W-gauge boson mass MR &gt
 720 GeV, which has been experimentally obtained recently by the D0 Collaboration at Fermilab. By using the data for the KL -KS mass difference, the CP violating parameter ε in the neutral kaon system and Bd-B̄d mixing, together with the new data Br (B- →ψπ-) / Br (B- → ψK-) = 0.052 ± 0.024 (≈\\ Vcd/Vcs \\2), we are able to fix all three independent angles and one phase of the right-handed mixing matrix VR. Under these constraints, another CP-violating parameter, ε′'/ε, and the electric dipole moment of the neutron are shown to be consistent with the data in our model. The pattern of CP violation in the nonleptonic decay of Bd (Bs) mesons to CP eigenstates is different from that, in the standard model.

paper_title.ja: 高校物理教育に関するアンケート調査-現状と課題-「（共著）」

paper_title.en: B AND D MESON DECAYS IN THE HEAVY-QUARK EFFECTIVE THEORY

description.en: We study semi- and non-leptonic decays of B and D mesons in the heavy-quark effective theory (HQET). By using the maximum likelihood method, it is shown that not only B decays but also D decays (D-0 --> K- (l) over bar v(l), D-0 --> K(-)pi(+) and K(-)rho(+)) are well described if O(<(Lambda)over bar>/m(c)) and O(<(Lambda)over bar>/m(s)) corrections are both taken into account.

paper_title.en: RIGHT-HANDED B-TO-C COUPLING AND CP VIOLATION

description.en: We investigate CP violation effects for purely right-handed b to c coupling within the SU(2)(L) x SU(2)(R) x U(1) model with a simple form of right-handed mixing matrix V-R. In this model, CP violation is caused by the right-handed interaction. We do not have to give extremely small values to the phases fully considered in V-R in order to accommodate CP violation (epsilon) in the neutral kaon system. We obtain an upper bound of the neutron electric dipole moment by use of the constraint on the product of W-L . W-R mixing angle and phase obtained from another CP-violating parameter epsilon'. A considerably different CP-violating pattern from that of the standard model is predicted for the nonleptonic decay of neutral B mesons to CP eigenstates.

paper_title.en: B and D Meson Decays in the Heavy Quark Effective Theory 「(jointly worked)」
Right-Handed b to c Coupling and CP Violation 「(jointly worked)」

paper_title.ja: Measuring the chirality of the b-quark current in Λb decays

publication_name.ja: J. Phys. G: Nucl. Part. Phys.

paper_title.en: FACTORIZATION HYPOTHESIS FOR B-NONLEPTONIC DECAYS WITHIN THE HEAVY QUARK EFFECTIVE THEORY

description.en: The heavy quark effective theory is applied to B-meson nonleptonic decays B0BAR --> D(*)+ pi, D(*)+ rho at the level of O(LAMBDABAR/m(c)) (LAMBDABAR congruent-to O(LAMBDA(QCD)) corrections. It is shown that, with several parameters determined via the semileptonic decays B0BAR --> D(*)+lv(l)BAR, these nonleptonic decays are well described under the factorization hypothesis, which can be interpreted as a new test of this hypothesis beyond the lowest order approximation.
